alert.note: Alert for Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 3:46AM CDT until June 05 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following county, Pushmataha. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 345 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in localized areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Antlers... Clayton... Rattan... Snow... Dunbar... Stanley... Cloudy... Kosoma... Clayton Lake State Park... Oleta... Moyers... Nashoba... Kellond... Tuskahoma... Finley... Eubanks... Dela... Corinne... Sardis... Sobol... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
